abstract: Eric Asimov The Pour column holds that the Finger Lakes region of New York, once known only for growing concord grapes for juice, is now making riesling and some red wines that can compete with the world's best; distinctive wines from region listed.
snippet: The Finger Lakes, a region once known only for growing concord grapes for juice, is now making rieslings and some reds that can compete with the world’s best.
lead_paragraph: The Finger Lakes, a region once known only for growing concord grapes for juice, is now making rieslings and some reds that can compete with the world’s best.

headline.main: Deep Lakes, Icy Climate, Great Wine
headline.seo: From the Finger Lakes, Seriously Good Wines
headline.print_headline: Deep Lakes, Icy Climate, Great Wine
